result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Joel E. Brown was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel E. Brown

records.addlTxt: of discharge upon expiration of commitment

Defendant Joel E. Brown in court with attorney Jack Chavez.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klomberg heard, Mr. Chavez was released from custody in error on Case 14CF68, he will be taken into custody following this hearing.  Attorney Chavez states the revocation of conditional release is contested.  Attorney Klomberg calls Samantha Frey, S/T.  Witness identifies defendant.  Cross examination by Attorney Chavez.  Witness excused.  State has no further witnesses.  Attorney Chavez calls Cami Vande Berg, S/T.  Cross examination by Attorney Klomberg.  Witness excused.  Attorney Chavez recalls Samantha Frey, court amonishes still under oath. Witness excused.  Defense rests.  Attorney Chavez heard on arguments.  Court heard, finds state has met its burden.  Court revokes conditional release.  Discussion held.  Atorney Klomberg heard, requesting defendant be admitted to Mendota, if revoked will be asking for the committment to be released and return to prison.  Attorney Chavez heard.  Court heard, defendant ordered to Mendota upon revocation, to be held at the Dodge County Jail until a bed becomes available.

records.addlTxt: 14CF68 & 14CF277: Defendant Joel E. Brown in court, in custody with attorney Katherine M. Findley.  Kurt F. Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Findley notes that she recently found out that she has a conflict in these cases and moves to withdraw; State heard - close to time limits on this case; Atty. Findley notes that SPD will be reappointing; State heard on statute and time limits, question on why Atty. Vollan not the attorney of record; Court reviews Def.'s rights, 30 days is up next week; Court notes Def. is not waiving time limits and wishes hearing and will proceed pro so; Court sets next hearing 1/17/18 at 10:30am; State heard further; Def. wishes to speak to State w/o counsel, waives right to same; State to meet with Def. now. Recalled 4:08pm. Attorney Kurt F. Klomberg appears for the State of WI. Def. Joel Brown appears in court in custody.  Atty Klomberg heard, have come to proposal to resolve matter today - will w/draw petition, lift stay and impose 6 mo DCJ w/Huber for work and treatment ONLY in 14CF68. Def heard, agrees. Court advises right to have hearing, and Attorney. Def wishes to proceed. Court will in case 14CF68 modify sentence and order 6 months DCJ w/out electronic monitoring, with Huber for work and treatment comm. forthwith. Attorney Klomberg moves to w/draw petition for revocation of conditional release. Motion Granted.

(14CF68 & 14CF277) Defendant Joel E. Brown in court, in custody with attorney Katherine Marie Findley.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file re; issue with jail and def's medications; State calls Jail Administrator Anthony Brugger, sworn & testifies; discussion held; Court heard and will approve revised order re medications; DA's office to prepare order

(14CF68, 14CF277, 15CF89 & 15CF192) Defendant Joel E. Brown in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held; Court reviews plea agreement; NGI pleas other than the plea in 14CF277 are withdrawan; Court reviews def's rights; Court reveiws chgs and pens; no contest plea is entered in count 1 of 14CF68 w/o enhancer; no contest plea is entered in count 1 of 15CF192, no contest plea is entered in count 1 of 15CF89; no contest/NGI plea is entered in 14CF277 all counts; parties stipulate to facts; Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty as follows: count 1 w/o penalty enhancer in 14CF68 and count 2 is dismissed; guilty of count 1 of 15CF192 w/counts 2 & 3 dismissed and count 4 is dismissed and read in; guilty of count 1 in 15CF89 and counts 4 & 5 are dismissed and read in and remaining counts are dismissed; Court accepts plea of no contest/NGI in 14CF277 all counts and finds defendant guilty/NGI; Court heard and will order a 4 year commitment to DHS inpatient; Parties make sentencing arguments; defendant makes statement; Court heard and sentence is imposed:

15CF192:
108 day DCJ concurrent w/h&t w/83 days credit - time served
costs

15CF89:
50 days DCJ concurrent w/h&t w/39 days credit - time served
costs

14CF68:
w/h
5 yr P&P
1 year DCJ - imposed & stayed to be used on recommendation to the Court for ATR
Shall maintain compliance w/any drug and alcohol and mental health treatment
shall maintain absolute sobriety from all drugs othe+
shall not take any drugs except those prescribed by a doctor and taken in accordance w/prescription
shall notify any doctor of opiate addiction
Is to involve self in regular treatment for drugs issues
costs (shall collect costs in all matters)

Defendant Joel E. Brown in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; NG and NGI pleas entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't.  Atty Vollan request court examiner be appointed.  Atty Klomberg request court appoint an examiner of its own choosing and w/o recomendation from the parties.  Court appoints Dr. Schoeniker .  Court finds basis for evaluation due to injury sustained and memory loss.  Court calls 14CF277 by stipulation of counsel;  this case is assigned to Br. 1.  Court modifies pleas to NG & NGI.  Court also appoints Dr. Schoeniker in that case.  Court heard on request for bail modification.  Victim makes statement, court and Atty Vollan questions witness.  Victim sworn at request of Atty Klomberg.  Atty Klomberg questions witness.  Arguments by Atty Vollan on request to modify conditions of bail.  Atty Klomberg heard, objects to bail modification.  Court heard and modifies bail:

$3,000 cash
Court lifts no contact provision w/JLR and her children
Court orders no abusive or violent contact with anyone
No contact w/T.T.

Defendant Joel E. Brown in court with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $1000 Cash bond  with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
